H0.text: Stays constant is the behavior of wave energy as wave frequency is increased.

H1.text: Wave energy is unaffected as wave frequency is increased.

H2.text: Increases is the wave energy that results as wave frequency is increased.

H3.text: Wave energy decreases as wave frequency is increased.

A4.text: The energy of the ejected electron is related only to the light's frequency, not to its intensity.

A5.text: The Maxwell theory predicts that the energy of a light wave depends only on its intensity, not on its frequency.

A6.text: The amount of absorption will generally depend on the frequency (wavelength) of the wave, which, for instance, explains why objects may appear colored.

A7.text: Wave spectrum is a representation that describes how the energy of a sea surface (or wave field) is distributed across different wave frequencies (or wave numbers) and directions.

A8.text: In quantum theory (see first quantization) the energy of the photons is thus directly proportional to the frequency of the EMR wave.

A9.text: In higher frequencies (some of visible and beyond), the effects of individual photons begin to become important, as these now have enough energy individually to directly or indirectly damage biological molecules.
